column4: I kinda need your help. It seems that my network card (who used to work perfectly on windows, both ethernet and wifi) can't detect any wireless network. I'm connected with my eth, but i don't have any wlan option.

Hi there :) I got a wifi problem that i can't fix. My card is recognized by Ubuntu. It's a Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8139/8139C/8139C+ (rev 10) but i can't use the wireless option (no wlan0 option)

Hi there :) I got a wifi problem that i can't fix. My card is recognized by Ubuntu. It's a Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8139/8139C/8139C+ (rev 10) but i can't use the wireless option (no wlan0 option)

Hi there :) I got a wifi problem that i can't fix. My card is recognized by Ubuntu. It's a Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8139/8139C/8139C+ (rev 10) but i can't use the wireless option (no wlan0 option)
Please help me i don' know what else to do i've tried everyhing i could see on the internet...
yes, but the ISO will have been created at launch time back in October
search on amazon for "linux wireless dongle" or similar
it probably is. Try pluggin in the computer via a cable, running an update, and trying the dongle again
The thing is I don't have any dongle it's a wireless card in my mother card. (Please excuse my bad english, I'm europ√©an)
same idea anyway - connect via cable and update
You advice me to update my driver ?
Cause I've been looking for a linux driver for my card but I never found it...
run the Update Manager until there are no more updates
Except some python or ubuntuone updates i don't have anything else...
Well i don't have any updates left.
